## Geom info
::: {style="font-size: 1.25em; color: #38B44A;"}
**What does this geom do?**
:::

<br>

```{r}
#| label: full_code_display
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '80%'
#| out-width: '80%'
#| fig-align: right
library(palmerpenguins) 
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)

peng_bar <- palmerpenguins::penguins |> 
    dplyr::filter(!is.na(island) & !is.na(sex))

ggp2_bar_base <- ggplot(data = peng_bar)

ggp2_bar_x <- ggp2_bar_base + 
    geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = island)) + 
    theme_ggp2g(base_size = 7)

ggp2_bar_fill <- ggp2_bar_base + 
    geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = island, 
        fill = island), show.legend = FALSE) + 
    theme_ggp2g(base_size = 7)

ggp2_bar_fill2 <- ggp2_bar_base + 
    geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = island, 
        fill = sex)) + 
    theme_ggp2g(base_size = 7)

ggp2_bar_dodge <- ggp2_bar_base + 
    geom_bar(mapping = 
            aes(x = island, fill = sex),
                position = "dodge") + 
    theme_ggp2g(base_size = 7)

ggp2_bar_x + 
    ggp2_bar_fill + 
    ggp2_bar_fill2 + 
    ggp2_bar_dodge + 
    patchwork::plot_layout(nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
```

`geom_bar()` computes the number of rows per level (or group) of a categorical variable, then creates bars with the length of the bar proportional the `count` per level.

## BAR

:::: {.panel-tabset}

### Build

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**BUILD:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: build_geom_bar
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
ggp2_bar_x <- ggp2_bar_base + 
    geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = island))
bld_bar_x <- ggplot2::ggplot_build(ggp2_bar_x)
names(bld_bar_x)
bar_x_data <- bld_bar_x[["data"]][[1]]
glimpse(bar_x_data)
```
:::

#| warning: false
